intro: Othonna cymbalariifolia, commonly known as the Cape primrose, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, dark green leaves that are oval and slightly pointed, with a velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and purple, typically during the spring and summer months. It is well adapted to arid conditions, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Othonna cymbalariifolia thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
